user_error_text: I get 'GPU not outputting video' and the screen is unusable.
symptoms: Symptoms: GPU not outputting video. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: No Display / Black Screen.
cause: Cable/port issues, GPU not initializing, incorrect BIOS output, or driver failure.
step_1: Power off and disconnect the monitor, then reconnect the video cable firmly.
step_2: Try a different cable and port (HDMI -> DisplayPort) and test another monitor if available.
step_3: Plug the monitor into the motherboard video port to check integrated graphics output.
step_4: Boot into Safe Mode and reinstall graphics drivers using DDU for a clean uninstall.
step_5: Reseat the GPU in PCIe slot and test the GPU/monitor on another system if still blank.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: GPU not outputting video - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: Banding or color issues happens when I boot or when running games.
symptoms: Symptoms: Banding or color issues. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Color / Brightness / Visual Distortion.
cause: Panel calibration issues, driver color profile problems, or hardware failure.
step_1: Reset monitor color settings to factory defaults via the OSD menu.
step_2: Update or reinstall graphics drivers and color profile settings.
step_3: Run a simple pixel test to identify dead/stuck pixels and attempt gentle pixel healing tools.
step_4: If color accuracy needed, use calibration tools or a colorimeter for professional calibration.
step_5: If artifacts persist, test with alternate display and cable to isolate GPU vs monitor fault.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Banding or color issues - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

error_name: Fan speed stuck at low RPM
user_error_text: My monitor shows: Fan speed stuck at low RPM — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Fan speed stuck at low RPM. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: GPU Overheating & Thermal Throttling.
cause: Inadequate cooling, dusty heatsink, failing fan, or heavy GPU load causing throttling.
step_1: Monitor GPU temperatures with a tool (HWMonitor, GPU-Z) and note spikes under load.
step_2: Clean dust from GPU heatsink and ensure fans spin freely; reapply thermal paste if old.
step_3: Ensure case airflow is adequate and remove obstructions near intake/exhaust.
step_4: Underclock slightly or use a custom fan curve to reduce temperatures during heavy use.
step_5: If thermal issues persist, consider GPU cooler replacement or RMA for hardware faults.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Fan speed stuck at low RPM - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: I get 'GPU driver crash' and the screen is unusable.
symptoms: Symptoms: GPU driver crash. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: GPU Driver Failures.
cause: Corrupted or incompatible GPU driver, OS update conflict, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot to Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using Display Driver Uninstaller (DDU).
step_2: Download and install the latest stable GPU drivers from the vendor (NVIDIA/AMD/Intel).
step_3: Check Windows Update optional drivers and install recommended driver packages.
step_4: Test with integrated graphics to see if the system is stable without discrete GPU drivers.
step_5: If crashes persist, check Event Viewer for TDR events and consider GPU hardware tests.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: GPU driver crash - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: My monitor shows: Blurry display — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Blurry display. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Resolution & Scaling Problems.
cause: Incorrect driver, wrong display settings, or incompatible scaling/refresh settings.
step_1: Set the native resolution in Display Settings and ensure scaling is at 100% for clarity.
step_2: Update GPU drivers and reinstall monitor drivers if listed in Device Manager.
step_3: Use monitor OSD to check supported resolutions and adjust accordingly.
step_4: If using a high-DPI display, adjust application scaling via compatibility settings.
step_5: Try a different cable (DP/HDMI) that supports the desired resolution/refresh rate.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Blurry display - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: After an update, I notice: Vertical flicker lines.
symptoms: Symptoms: Vertical flicker lines. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Screen Flickering / Flashing.
cause: Driver conflicts, refresh rate mismatch, loose cable, or failing panel.
step_1: Check and reseat the video cable; try a different cable or port.
step_2: Set the monitor refresh rate to a supported value in Display Settings.
step_3: Update or roll back the display driver; use DDU for a clean uninstall if needed.
step_4: Disable hardware acceleration in the app that's flickering (browser/video player).
step_5: Test monitor on another PC to rule out panel or cable defects.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Vertical flicker lines - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Screen tint (yellow/green) - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: Problem: Blurry display — display not working as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Blurry display. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Resolution & Scaling Problems.
cause: Incorrect driver, wrong display settings, or incompatible scaling/refresh settings.
step_1: Set the native resolution in Display Settings and ensure scaling is at 100% for clarity.
step_2: Update GPU drivers and reinstall monitor drivers if listed in Device Manager.
step_3: Use monitor OSD to check supported resolutions and adjust accordingly.
step_4: If using a high-DPI display, adjust application scaling via compatibility settings.
step_5: Try a different cable (DP/HDMI) that supports the desired resolution/refresh rate.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Blurry display - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: My monitor shows: Driver timeout during gaming — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Driver timeout during gaming. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: GPU Driver Failures.
cause: Corrupted or incompatible GPU driver, OS update conflict, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot to Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using Display Driver Uninstaller (DDU).
step_2: Download and install the latest stable GPU drivers from the vendor (NVIDIA/AMD/Intel).
step_3: Check Windows Update optional drivers and install recommended driver packages.
step_4: Test with integrated graphics to see if the system is stable without discrete GPU drivers.
step_5: If crashes persist, check Event Viewer for TDR events and consider GPU hardware tests.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Driver timeout during gaming - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: GPU overheating causing FPS drops happens when I boot or when running games.
symptoms: Symptoms: GPU overheating causing FPS drops. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: GPU Overheating & Thermal Throttling.
cause: Inadequate cooling, dusty heatsink, failing fan, or heavy GPU load causing throttling.
step_1: Monitor GPU temperatures with a tool (HWMonitor, GPU-Z) and note spikes under load.
step_2: Clean dust from GPU heatsink and ensure fans spin freely; reapply thermal paste if old.
step_3: Ensure case airflow is adequate and remove obstructions near intake/exhaust.
step_4: Underclock slightly or use a custom fan curve to reduce temperatures during heavy use.
step_5: If thermal issues persist, consider GPU cooler replacement or RMA for hardware faults.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: GPU overheating causing FPS drops - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: Problem: No signal to monitor — display not working as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: No signal to monitor. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: No Display / Black Screen.
cause: Cable/port issues, GPU not initializing, incorrect BIOS output, or driver failure.
step_1: Power off and disconnect the monitor, then reconnect the video cable firmly.
step_2: Try a different cable and port (HDMI -> DisplayPort) and test another monitor if available.
step_3: Plug the monitor into the motherboard video port to check integrated graphics output.
step_4: Boot into Safe Mode and reinstall graphics drivers using DDU for a clean uninstall.
step_5: Reseat the GPU in PCIe slot and test the GPU/monitor on another system if still blank.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: No signal to monitor - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: Display service restarting repeatedly happens when I boot or when running games.
symptoms: Symptoms: Display service restarting repeatedly. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Screen Flickering / Flashing.
cause: Driver conflicts, refresh rate mismatch, loose cable, or failing panel.

step_4: Disable hardware acceleration in the app that's flickering (browser/video player).

verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Display service restarting repeatedly - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

symptoms: Symptoms: Display not detected. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Monitor Detection Issues.
cause: EDID/port problems, cable faults, or incorrect multi-monitor configuration.
step_1: Open Display Settings -> Detect and try 'Detect' to force Windows to find monitors.
step_2: Ensure EDID information is not blocked by adapters; use direct cable connections.
step_3: Update monitor drivers and GPU drivers; try different cables/ports.
step_4: Reset monitor to factory defaults and check OSD for input selection.
step_5: If missing, test the monitor on another PC to confirm detection behavior.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.

user_error_text: My monitor shows: Dead/stuck pixels — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Dead/stuck pixels. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Color / Brightness / Visual Distortion.
cause: Panel calibration issues, driver color profile problems, or hardware failure.
step_1: Reset monitor color settings to factory defaults via the OSD menu.
step_2: Update or reinstall graphics drivers and color profile settings.
step_3: Run a simple pixel test to identify dead/stuck pixels and attempt gentle pixel healing tools.
step_4: If color accuracy needed, use calibration tools or a colorimeter for professional calibration.
step_5: If artifacts persist, test with alternate display and cable to isolate GPU vs monitor fault.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Dead/stuck pixels - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: I get 'Flicker at high refresh rate' and the screen is unusable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Flicker at high refresh rate. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Screen Flickering / Flashing.
cause: Driver conflicts, refresh rate mismatch, loose cable, or failing panel.
step_1: Check and reseat the video cable; try a different cable or port.
step_2: Set the monitor refresh rate to a supported value in Display Settings.
step_3: Update or roll back the display driver; use DDU for a clean uninstall if needed.
step_4: Disable hardware acceleration in the app that's flickering (browser/video player).
step_5: Test monitor on another PC to rule out panel or cable defects.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Flicker at high refresh rate - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

error_name: Blue screen caused by display driver
user_error_text: Problem: Blue screen caused by display driver — display not working as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Blue screen caused by display driver. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: GPU Driver Failures.
cause: Corrupted or incompatible GPU driver, OS update conflict, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot to Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using Display Driver Uninstaller (DDU).
step_2: Download and install the latest stable GPU drivers from the vendor (NVIDIA/AMD/Intel).
step_3: Check Windows Update optional drivers and install recommended driver packages.
step_4: Test with integrated graphics to see if the system is stable without discrete GPU drivers.
step_5: If crashes persist, check Event Viewer for TDR events and consider GPU hardware tests.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Blue screen caused by display driver - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: GPU overheating causing FPS drops happens when I boot or when running games.
symptoms: Symptoms: GPU overheating causing FPS drops. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: GPU Overheating & Thermal Throttling.
cause: Inadequate cooling, dusty heatsink, failing fan, or heavy GPU load causing throttling.
step_1: Monitor GPU temperatures with a tool (HWMonitor, GPU-Z) and note spikes under load.
step_2: Clean dust from GPU heatsink and ensure fans spin freely; reapply thermal paste if old.
step_3: Ensure case airflow is adequate and remove obstructions near intake/exhaust.
step_4: Underclock slightly or use a custom fan curve to reduce temperatures during heavy use.
step_5: If thermal issues persist, consider GPU cooler replacement or RMA for hardware faults.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: GPU overheating causing FPS drops - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

symptoms: Symptoms: Wrong display order. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Monitor Detection Issues.
cause: EDID/port problems, cable faults, or incorrect multi-monitor configuration.
step_1: Open Display Settings -> Detect and try 'Detect' to force Windows to find monitors.
step_2: Ensure EDID information is not blocked by adapters; use direct cable connections.

verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.

step_2: Try a different cable and port (HDMI -> DisplayPort) and test another monitor if available.
step_3: Plug the monitor into the motherboard video port to check integrated graphics output.
step_4: Boot into Safe Mode and reinstall graphics drivers using DDU for a clean uninstall.
step_5: Reseat the GPU in PCIe slot and test the GPU/monitor on another system if still blank.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: GPU not outputting video - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: I get 'Damaged HDMI cable' and the screen is unusable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Damaged HDMI cable. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Hardware Failure: GPU / Monitor.
cause: Physical GPU/monitor component failure such as VRAM, backlight, or cable damage.
step_1: Inspect cables and connectors for visible damage; replace if frayed or bent.
step_2: Test GPU or monitor on a known-good system to confirm hardware failure.
step_3: If monitor backlight fails, check warranty or arrange monitor repair/replacement.
step_4: If GPU shows artifacts or fails on other systems, contact vendor for RMA/repair.
step_5: Backup important data and avoid heavy GPU loads until hardware is replaced.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Damaged HDMI cable - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: My monitor shows: Thermal throttling under load — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Thermal throttling under load. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: GPU Overheating & Thermal Throttling.
cause: Inadequate cooling, dusty heatsink, failing fan, or heavy GPU load causing throttling.
step_1: Monitor GPU temperatures with a tool (HWMonitor, GPU-Z) and note spikes under load.
step_2: Clean dust from GPU heatsink and ensure fans spin freely; reapply thermal paste if old.
step_3: Ensure case airflow is adequate and remove obstructions near intake/exhaust.
step_4: Underclock slightly or use a custom fan curve to reduce temperatures during heavy use.
step_5: If thermal issues persist, consider GPU cooler replacement or RMA for hardware faults.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Thermal throttling under load - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: After an update, I notice: Display service restarting repeatedly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Display service restarting repeatedly. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Screen Flickering / Flashing.
cause: Driver conflicts, refresh rate mismatch, loose cable, or failing panel.
step_1: Check and reseat the video cable; try a different cable or port.
step_2: Set the monitor refresh rate to a supported value in Display Settings.
step_3: Update or roll back the display driver; use DDU for a clean uninstall if needed.
step_4: Disable hardware acceleration in the app that's flickering (browser/video player).
step_5: Test monitor on another PC to rule out panel or cable defects.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Display service restarting repeatedly - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

symptoms: Symptoms: Color accuracy problems. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Color / Brightness / Visual Distortion.
cause: Panel calibration issues, driver color profile problems, or hardware failure.

user_error_text: Problem: Incorrect DPI scaling — display not working as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Incorrect DPI scaling. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Resolution & Scaling Problems.
cause: Incorrect driver, wrong display settings, or incompatible scaling/refresh settings.
step_1: Set the native resolution in Display Settings and ensure scaling is at 100% for clarity.
step_2: Update GPU drivers and reinstall monitor drivers if listed in Device Manager.
step_3: Use monitor OSD to check supported resolutions and adjust accordingly.
step_4: If using a high-DPI display, adjust application scaling via compatibility settings.
step_5: Try a different cable (DP/HDMI) that supports the desired resolution/refresh rate.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.

user_error_text: VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE happens when I boot or when running games.
symptoms: Symptoms: VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: GPU Driver Failures.
cause: Corrupted or incompatible GPU driver, OS update conflict, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot to Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using Display Driver Uninstaller (DDU).
step_2: Download and install the latest stable GPU drivers from the vendor (NVIDIA/AMD/Intel).
step_3: Check Windows Update optional drivers and install recommended driver packages.
step_4: Test with integrated graphics to see if the system is stable without discrete GPU drivers.
step_5: If crashes persist, check Event Viewer for TDR events and consider GPU hardware tests.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.

symptoms: Symptoms: Wrong display order. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Monitor Detection Issues.
cause: EDID/port problems, cable faults, or incorrect multi-monitor configuration.
step_1: Open Display Settings -> Detect and try 'Detect' to force Windows to find monitors.
step_2: Ensure EDID information is not blocked by adapters; use direct cable connections.
step_3: Update monitor drivers and GPU drivers; try different cables/ports.
step_4: Reset monitor to factory defaults and check OSD for input selection.
step_5: If missing, test the monitor on another PC to confirm detection behavior.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.

symptoms: Symptoms: Black screen after boot. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: No Display / Black Screen.
cause: Cable/port issues, GPU not initializing, incorrect BIOS output, or driver failure.
step_1: Power off and disconnect the monitor, then reconnect the video cable firmly.
step_2: Try a different cable and port (HDMI -> DisplayPort) and test another monitor if available.
step_3: Plug the monitor into the motherboard video port to check integrated graphics output.
step_4: Boot into Safe Mode and reinstall graphics drivers using DDU for a clean uninstall.
step_5: Reseat the GPU in PCIe slot and test the GPU/monitor on another system if still blank.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Black screen after boot - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: Damaged HDMI cable happens when I boot or when running games.
symptoms: Symptoms: Damaged HDMI cable. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Hardware Failure: GPU / Monitor.
cause: Physical GPU/monitor component failure such as VRAM, backlight, or cable damage.
step_1: Inspect cables and connectors for visible damage; replace if frayed or bent.
step_2: Test GPU or monitor on a known-good system to confirm hardware failure.
step_3: If monitor backlight fails, check warranty or arrange monitor repair/replacement.
step_4: If GPU shows artifacts or fails on other systems, contact vendor for RMA/repair.
step_5: Backup important data and avoid heavy GPU loads until hardware is replaced.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Damaged HDMI cable - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: Banding or color issues happens when I boot or when running games.
symptoms: Symptoms: Banding or color issues. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Color / Brightness / Visual Distortion.
cause: Panel calibration issues, driver color profile problems, or hardware failure.
step_1: Reset monitor color settings to factory defaults via the OSD menu.
step_2: Update or reinstall graphics drivers and color profile settings.
step_3: Run a simple pixel test to identify dead/stuck pixels and attempt gentle pixel healing tools.
step_4: If color accuracy needed, use calibration tools or a colorimeter for professional calibration.
step_5: If artifacts persist, test with alternate display and cable to isolate GPU vs monitor fault.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Banding or color issues - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: After an update, I notice: VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE.
symptoms: Symptoms: VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: GPU Driver Failures.
cause: Corrupted or incompatible GPU driver, OS update conflict, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot to Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using Display Driver Uninstaller (DDU).
step_2: Download and install the latest stable GPU drivers from the vendor (NVIDIA/AMD/Intel).
step_3: Check Windows Update optional drivers and install recommended driver packages.
step_4: Test with integrated graphics to see if the system is stable without discrete GPU drivers.
step_5: If crashes persist, check Event Viewer for TDR events and consider GPU hardware tests.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: I get 'Thermal throttling under load' and the screen is unusable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Thermal throttling under load. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: GPU Overheating & Thermal Throttling.
cause: Inadequate cooling, dusty heatsink, failing fan, or heavy GPU load causing throttling.
step_1: Monitor GPU temperatures with a tool (HWMonitor, GPU-Z) and note spikes under load.
step_2: Clean dust from GPU heatsink and ensure fans spin freely; reapply thermal paste if old.
step_3: Ensure case airflow is adequate and remove obstructions near intake/exhaust.
step_4: Underclock slightly or use a custom fan curve to reduce temperatures during heavy use.
step_5: If thermal issues persist, consider GPU cooler replacement or RMA for hardware faults.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.

step_4: If GPU shows artifacts or fails on other systems, contact vendor for RMA/repair.
step_5: Backup important data and avoid heavy GPU loads until hardware is replaced.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Failing GPU causing artifacts - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: After an update, I notice: Monitor shows 'No signal'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Monitor shows 'No signal'. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: No Display / Black Screen.
cause: Cable/port issues, GPU not initializing, incorrect BIOS output, or driver failure.
step_1: Power off and disconnect the monitor, then reconnect the video cable firmly.
step_2: Try a different cable and port (HDMI -> DisplayPort) and test another monitor if available.
step_3: Plug the monitor into the motherboard video port to check integrated graphics output.
step_4: Boot into Safe Mode and reinstall graphics drivers using DDU for a clean uninstall.
step_5: Reseat the GPU in PCIe slot and test the GPU/monitor on another system if still blank.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Monitor shows 'No signal' - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: Problem: Display driver stopped responding — display not working as expected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Display driver stopped responding. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: GPU Driver Failures.
cause: Corrupted or incompatible GPU driver, OS update conflict, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot to Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using Display Driver Uninstaller (DDU).
step_2: Download and install the latest stable GPU drivers from the vendor (NVIDIA/AMD/Intel).
step_3: Check Windows Update optional drivers and install recommended driver packages.
step_4: Test with integrated graphics to see if the system is stable without discrete GPU drivers.
step_5: If crashes persist, check Event Viewer for TDR events and consider GPU hardware tests.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Display driver stopped responding - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: After an update, I notice: Screen flickering intermittently.
symptoms: Symptoms: Screen flickering intermittently. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Screen Flickering / Flashing.
cause: Driver conflicts, refresh rate mismatch, loose cable, or failing panel.
step_1: Check and reseat the video cable; try a different cable or port.
step_2: Set the monitor refresh rate to a supported value in Display Settings.
step_3: Update or roll back the display driver; use DDU for a clean uninstall if needed.
step_4: Disable hardware acceleration in the app that's flickering (browser/video player).
step_5: Test monitor on another PC to rule out panel or cable defects.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Screen flickering intermittently - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: After an update, I notice: HDMI/DP port not working.
symptoms: Symptoms: HDMI/DP port not working. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Monitor Detection Issues.
cause: EDID/port problems, cable faults, or incorrect multi-monitor configuration.
step_1: Open Display Settings -> Detect and try 'Detect' to force Windows to find monitors.
step_2: Ensure EDID information is not blocked by adapters; use direct cable connections.
step_3: Update monitor drivers and GPU drivers; try different cables/ports.
step_4: Reset monitor to factory defaults and check OSD for input selection.
step_5: If missing, test the monitor on another PC to confirm detection behavior.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: HDMI/DP port not working - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: My monitor shows: Thermal throttling under load — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Thermal throttling under load. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: GPU Overheating & Thermal Throttling.
cause: Inadequate cooling, dusty heatsink, failing fan, or heavy GPU load causing throttling.
step_1: Monitor GPU temperatures with a tool (HWMonitor, GPU-Z) and note spikes under load.
step_2: Clean dust from GPU heatsink and ensure fans spin freely; reapply thermal paste if old.
step_3: Ensure case airflow is adequate and remove obstructions near intake/exhaust.
step_4: Underclock slightly or use a custom fan curve to reduce temperatures during heavy use.
step_5: If thermal issues persist, consider GPU cooler replacement or RMA for hardware faults.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Thermal throttling under load - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

step_5: Test monitor on another PC to rule out panel or cable defects.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Flicker at high refresh rate - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: My monitor shows: GPU not outputting video — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: GPU not outputting video. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: No Display / Black Screen.
cause: Cable/port issues, GPU not initializing, incorrect BIOS output, or driver failure.
step_1: Power off and disconnect the monitor, then reconnect the video cable firmly.
step_2: Try a different cable and port (HDMI -> DisplayPort) and test another monitor if available.
step_3: Plug the monitor into the motherboard video port to check integrated graphics output.
step_4: Boot into Safe Mode and reinstall graphics drivers using DDU for a clean uninstall.
step_5: Reseat the GPU in PCIe slot and test the GPU/monitor on another system if still blank.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: GPU not outputting video - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: After an update, I notice: Display not detected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Display not detected. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Monitor Detection Issues.
cause: EDID/port problems, cable faults, or incorrect multi-monitor configuration.
step_1: Open Display Settings -> Detect and try 'Detect' to force Windows to find monitors.
step_2: Ensure EDID information is not blocked by adapters; use direct cable connections.
step_3: Update monitor drivers and GPU drivers; try different cables/ports.
step_4: Reset monitor to factory defaults and check OSD for input selection.
step_5: If missing, test the monitor on another PC to confirm detection behavior.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Display not detected - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: After an update, I notice: Incorrect DPI scaling.
symptoms: Symptoms: Incorrect DPI scaling. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Resolution & Scaling Problems.
cause: Incorrect driver, wrong display settings, or incompatible scaling/refresh settings.
step_1: Set the native resolution in Display Settings and ensure scaling is at 100% for clarity.
step_2: Update GPU drivers and reinstall monitor drivers if listed in Device Manager.
step_3: Use monitor OSD to check supported resolutions and adjust accordingly.
step_4: If using a high-DPI display, adjust application scaling via compatibility settings.
step_5: Try a different cable (DP/HDMI) that supports the desired resolution/refresh rate.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Incorrect DPI scaling - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: After an update, I notice: Screen tint (yellow/green).
symptoms: Symptoms: Screen tint (yellow/green). Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Color / Brightness / Visual Distortion.
cause: Panel calibration issues, driver color profile problems, or hardware failure.
step_1: Reset monitor color settings to factory defaults via the OSD menu.
step_2: Update or reinstall graphics drivers and color profile settings.
step_3: Run a simple pixel test to identify dead/stuck pixels and attempt gentle pixel healing tools.
step_4: If color accuracy needed, use calibration tools or a colorimeter for professional calibration.
step_5: If artifacts persist, test with alternate display and cable to isolate GPU vs monitor fault.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Screen tint (yellow/green) - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: Display driver stopped responding happens when I boot or when running games.
symptoms: Symptoms: Display driver stopped responding. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: GPU Driver Failures.
cause: Corrupted or incompatible GPU driver, OS update conflict, or GPU hardware fault.
step_1: Boot to Safe Mode and remove GPU drivers using Display Driver Uninstaller (DDU).
step_2: Download and install the latest stable GPU drivers from the vendor (NVIDIA/AMD/Intel).
step_3: Check Windows Update optional drivers and install recommended driver packages.
step_4: Test with integrated graphics to see if the system is stable without discrete GPU drivers.
step_5: If crashes persist, check Event Viewer for TDR events and consider GPU hardware tests.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Display driver stopped responding - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.

user_error_text: After an update, I notice: Monitor power circuit failure.
symptoms: Symptoms: Monitor power circuit failure. Visible display problem such as no output, flicker, wrong resolution, artifacts, or overheating. Category: Hardware Failure: GPU / Monitor.
cause: Physical GPU/monitor component failure such as VRAM, backlight, or cable damage.
step_1: Inspect cables and connectors for visible damage; replace if frayed or bent.
step_2: Test GPU or monitor on a known-good system to confirm hardware failure.
step_3: If monitor backlight fails, check warranty or arrange monitor repair/replacement.
step_4: If GPU shows artifacts or fails on other systems, contact vendor for RMA/repair.
step_5: Backup important data and avoid heavy GPU loads until hardware is replaced.
verification: Display functions correctly under normal use and no further artifacts/flicker/black screens observed.
log_snippet: Monitor power circuit failure - Display/GPU diagnostic or Event Viewer entry.
